title: Google\Cloud\Talent\V4\PurgeJobsRequest
name: PurgeJobsRequest
description:
Request to purge a set of jobs.

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.talent.v4.PurgeJobsRequest

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.parent
params.description: Required. The resource name of the project under which the jobs should be deleted. The format is "projects/{project_id}". For example, "projects/foo".

params.name: data.filter
params.description: Required. A filter matching the jobs to be purged. The filter can be one of the following three parent resources. 1. Company. Resource name of the company under which all the jobs should be deleted. The format is "projects/{project_id}/tenants/{tenant_id}/companies/{company_id}". For example, "projects/foo/tenants/bar/companies/baz" 2. Tenant. Resource name of the tenant under which all the jobs should be deleted. The format is "projects/{project_id}/tenants/{tenant_id}". For example, "projects/foo/tenants/bar". 3. Project. Resource name of the project under which all the jobs should be deleted. The format is "projects/{project_id}". For example, "projects/foo/".

params.name: data.force
params.description: Actually perform the purge. If force is set to false, the method will return a sample of resource names that will be deleted.

Required. A filter matching the jobs to be purged.

The filter can be one of the following three parent resources.

  1. Company. Resource name of the company under which all the jobs should be deleted. The format is "projects/{project_id}/tenants/{tenant_id}/companies/{company_id}". For example, "projects/foo/tenants/bar/companies/baz"
  2. Tenant. Resource name of the tenant under which all the jobs should be deleted. The format is "projects/{project_id}/tenants/{tenant_id}". For example, "projects/foo/tenants/bar".
  3. Project. Resource name of the project under which all the jobs should be deleted. The format is "projects/{project_id}". For example, "projects/foo/".
